issue.title: Deprecate `TestCase::getMockBuilder()`
issue.body:
These deprecations ...

- https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/issues/5239
- https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/issues/5240
- https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/issues/5241
- https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/issues/5242
- https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/issues/5243
- https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/issues/5244

... also affect the methods of `PHPUnit\Framework\MockObject\MockBuilder` to configure the respective functionality.

The functionality configurable by `PHPUnit\Framework\MockObject\MockBuilder` that remains (not disabling the original constructor, not disabling the orginal clone constructor, cloning arguments passed to doubled methods, allowing the doubling on unknown types, and disabling automatic return value generation) should also be deprecated.

The `TestCase::getMockBuilder()` method will be deprecated and then removed:

- soft deprecation in [PHPUnit 10.1](https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/milestone/54) (add `@deprecated` annotation to the method declaration)
- deprecation in [PHPUnit 11](https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/milestone/46) (using the method will trigger a deprecation)
- removal in [PHPUnit 12](https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/milestone/52)

issue.title: Document getObjectForTrait()
issue.body:
[This duplicates this ticket https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit-documentation/issues/345 which has been closed since the documentation was moved to separate projects per language]

There's no mention of  the getObjectForTrait method in the documentation.

There was a blog article mentioning this method from 2011 https://sebastian-bergmann.de/archives/906-Testing-Traits.html but that seems to have vanished. 

The undocumented code is in phpunit/src/Framework/TestCase.php

issue.title: Add `trait` for 'standard' `Commentable` implementation

milestone.title: 9.0.0: Drop support for PHP < 7.2 and clean up things
milestone.description:
- [x] switch to a current coding standard (PER2) to make the code more readable and consistent with other projects
- [x] create a class diagram (in Mermaid embedded in Markdown) to help us understand the system
- [x] make the code coverage publicly visible, add a link or badge from the README to the code coverage reports, and have a tool report the effects of PRs on the code coverage numbers
- [x] do some automated  code cleanup (using Rector)
- [x] rename internal things (including parameter names) to ditch the Hungarian notation
- [x] every now and then test the latest development version with Emogrifier
- [x] release version 9.0.0

repository.name: PHP-CSS-Parser
repository.description: A Parser for CSS Files written in PHP. Allows extraction of CSS files into a data structure, manipulation of said structure and output as (optimized) CSS

issue.body:
The various classes that implement `Commentable` all seem to have exactly the same implementation.

This duplication could be avoided by using a `trait` for a 'standard' implementation.
